unbiasr 0.0.2

    Applied examples of item deletion statistics

    Plot classification accuracy indices at different proportions of selection or at different threshold (cutoff) values

    plotPropselRange.Rd

    plotPropselRange plots classification accuracy indices at different proportions of selection under partial and strict invariance conditions for a given CFA fit.

    Usage

    plotPropselRange(
  cfa_fit,
  pmix = NULL,
  labels = NULL,
  cai_names = c("PS", "SR", "SE", "SP", "AI"),
  mod_names = c("par", "str"),
  from = 0.01,
  to = 0.25,
  by = 0.01,
  cutoffs_from = NULL,
  cutoffs_to = NULL
)

    Arguments

    cfa_fit

    CFA model output from lavaan.

    pmix

    List of length g containing the mixing proportions of each group (where g is the number of groups). If NULL, defaults to 1/g for each group (i.e., the populations have equal size).

    labels

    A character vector with g elements to label the reference and focal groups on the plot, where g is the number of groups. If not provided, groups are labeled automatically as 'Reference' (for the first group) and 'Focal_1' through 'Focal_(g-1)', where g is the number of groups.

    cai_names

    A vector of strings indicating the classification accuracy indices of interest. c("PS", "SR", "SE", "SP", "AI) by default.

    mod_names

    A vector of strings indicating the invariance conditions of interest. c("par", "str") by default.

    from

    The lowest proportion of selection to consider. 0.01 by default.

    to

    The largest proportion of selection to consider. 0.25 by default.

    by

    The increment of the sequence of proportions. 0.01 by default.

    cutoffs_from

    The lowest threshold to consider.NULL by default.

    cutoffs_to

    The largest threshold to consider. NULL by default.

    Value

    Eight plots illustrating how proportion selected (PS), success ratio (SR), sensitivity (SE), and specificity (SP) change across different proportions of selection under partial and strict invariance conditions.

    Examples

    if (FALSE) {
library(lavaan)
HS <- HolzingerSwineford1939
HS$sex <- as.factor(HS$sex)
HS.model <- ' visual  =~ x1 + x2 + x3
              textual =~ x4 + x5 + x6
              speed   =~ x7 + x8 + x9 '

fit <- cfa(HS.model, data = HS, group = "sex")

# plot CAI at different proportions of selection
plotPropselRange(fit, pmix = table(HS$sex)/sum(table(HS$sex)))

# plot CAI at different cutoffs
plotPropselRange(fit, pmix = table(HS$sex)/sum(table(HS$sex)), 
   cutoffs_from = 35, cutoffs_to = 50)

# plot only SR under partial invariance for up to 10% selection.
plotPropselRange(fit, pmix = table(HS$sex)/sum(table(HS$sex)), 
    from = 0.01, to = 0.10, cai_names = "SR", mod_names = "par")
}
